remit.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to free someone from a debt or punishment
remit.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the particular piece of work that someone has been officially asked to deal with
remit.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: the remit of a senior member of staff
remit.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to send a payment to a person or place
remit.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: a ban preventing companies from remitting profits, dividends or capital abroad
Our overseas branches remit a small proportion of their profits to the parent company.
remit.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to send a legal case from a high court to a court that deals with less important cases
remit.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The appeal was remitted to the Employment Tribunal for a fresh hearing.
remit.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: to free someone from a debt or punishment
remit.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: The court has the power to remit the debt.
remit.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the particular area of activity or piece of work that a person or group has the responsibility for dealing with
remit.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: This problem is outside our remit.
Our remit was to make the newsletter brighter and livelier.
